citation.article-title: Agrococcus carbonis sp. nov., isolated from soil of a coal mine
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Agrococcus carbonis sp. nov.
Agrococcus carbonis (car.bo′nis. L. gen. n. carbonis of coal, of charcoal).
Cells are Gram-stain-positive, coccoid (1.0–1.5 µm in diameter) and arranged in pairs, tetrads and clusters.
Strictly aerobic and non-motile.
Colonies are circular, yellow and 0.4–3.0 mm in diameter on TSA medium.
Grows at 15–37 °C (optimum 30 °C) and pH 5–11 (optimum 7.5); no growth at 42 °C.
Catalase-positive and oxidase-negative.
Grows in the presence of ≤7 % NaCl.
Negative for starch hydrolysis, gelatin hydrolysis, citrate utilization, indole production, nitrate reduction and the methyl red and Voges–Proskauer tests.
Hydrogen sulphide is not produced.

Positive for utilization of the following substrates: dextrin, Tween 40, l-arabinose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-gluconic acid, α-d-glucose, maltose, d-mannose, α-methyl d-galactoside, palatinose, d-psicose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, sedoheptulose, sucrose, d-tagatose, turanose, d-xylose, β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, l-malic acid, succinic acid monomethyl ester, propionic acid, pyruvic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-serine, putrescine, glycerol, adenosine, 2′-deoxyadenosine, inosine, thymidine, uridine and thymidine 5′-monophosphate.

Negative for utilization of α-cyclodextrin, β-cyclodextrin, glycogen, inulin, mannan, Tween 80, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, N-acetyl-β-d-mannosamine, amygdalin, d-arabitol, arbutin, cellobiose, l-fucose, d-galacturonic acid, gentiobiose, myo-inositol, lactose, lactulose, maltotriose, d-mannitol, melezitose, melibiose, β-methyl d-galactoside, 3-methyl d-glucose, α-methyl d-glucoside, β-methyl d-glucoside, α-methyl d-mannoside, raffinose, salicin, d-sorbitol, stachyose, trehalose, xylitol, acetic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, lactamide, d-lactic acid methyl ester, l-lactic acid, d-malic acid, pyruvic acid methyl esters, succinamic acid, succinic acid, N-acetyl-l-glutamic acid, l-alaninamide, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-asparagine, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-pyroglutamic acid, 2,3-butanediol, adenosine 5′-monophosphate, uridine 5′-monophosphate, d-fructose 6-phosphate, α-d-glucose 1-phosphate, d-glucose 6-phosphate and dl-α-glycerol phosphate.

Acid is produced aerobically from adonitol, arabinose, cellobiose, glucose, fructose, maltose, mannose, melibiose, raffinose, xylose, sucrose and trehalose but not from dulcitol, galactose, inositol, inulin, lactose, mannitol, rhamnose or salicin.
Presence of B-type peptidoglycan containing the amino acids alanine, glycine, threonine, aspartic acid, glutamic acid and the diagnostic diaminobutyric acid.
The predominant fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0.
The major menaquinones are MK-9, MK-10 and MK-11.
The polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, two unknown glycolipids and six unknown lipids.
Cell wall sugars include galactose, glucose, ribose and rhamnose.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 73.8 mol%.
The type strain, G4T ( = MTCC 10213T = DSM 22965T), was isolated from a soil sample collected from a coal mine of West Bengal, India.
